Data from the Government Finance Officer: s office to support the claim that 50% of households claiming the State & Local Tax deduction make under $100K.
However: the data from the same report also shows that between 91% and 93% of households earning $200,000 and up take the deduction, indicating that higher-income households are more likely to benefit from the deduction.
Lower: income taxpayers are less likely to itemize their tax returns and therefore less likely to benefit from the state and local tax deduction.
